titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edmund W. Hubard papers, 1858
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

repository.label: Repository

did.abstract: Papers of Edmund W. Hubard referring to the appointment of a manager of the public schools and to physicians practicing in Richmond.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Edmund W. Hubard Papers, 1858, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Edmund Wilcox Hubard (1806-1878) was a planter and member of United States Congress, 1841-1847, of Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Papers of Edmund W. Hubard referring to the appointment of a manager of the public schools and to physicians practicing in Richmond.
